name: wlkpwrd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(c2, cword(c3)))

stmt.origin: syl(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(c2, cword(c3)), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c3))

comment: The sequence of vertices of a walk is a word over the set of vertices. (Contributed by AV, 27-Jan-2021.)
